intro: Streptocarpus hirsutissimus, commonly known as the woolly streptocarpus, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a perennial herb, often found in rocky or sandy soils. Its flowers, which range in color from white to pink, are adapted for pollination by insects. Streptocarpus hirsutissimus is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ease of cultivation.
